content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
using Printf

function wrap_string(str::String; text_width::Int=10)
    splitstr = split(str, " ")
    results = []
    for s in splitstr
        results = [results, " $(s)"]
        if lastindex(results) > 0 &&  count(results[lastindex], "\n") == 0
            if length(results[lastindex]) > text_width
                push!(results, "\n $(s)")
            end
        end
    end
    return join(results, " ")
end

example_string = """
    Hello world!
    This is a example of a long string that will be wrapped to a maximum of 10 characters per line.
    This is a second paragraph.
    This is a third paragraph with a very long sentence that will be wrapped to multiple lines.
"""

wrapped_string = wrap_string(example_string)
print(wrapped_string)

```
